title: Bias Assessment and Mitigation in LLM-based Code Generation. (arXiv:2309.14345v1 [cs.SE])
abstract: Utilizing state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs), automatic code generation models play a pivotal role in enhancing the productivity and efficiency of software development coding procedures. As the adoption of LLMs becomes more widespread in software coding ecosystems, a pressing issue has emerged: does the generated code contain social biases, such as those related to age, gender, and race? This issue concerns the integrity, fairness, and ethical foundation of software applications that depend on the code generated by these models, yet is under-explored in the literature. This paper presents a novel bias assessment framework that is specifically designed for code generation tasks. Based on this framework, we conduct an extensive evaluation on the bias of nine state-of-the-art LLM-based code generation models. tldr: 这项研究提出了一个新颖的偏差评估框架，针对代码生成任务进行设计。通过对九个最先进的基于LLM的代码生成模型进行广泛评估，发现其中31.45\%到79.93\%的代码函数具有偏见，并提出了如何缓解这种偏见的方法。
